org.openimaj.audio.processor

Class AudioProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.audio.Audio
      • org.openimaj.audio.AudioStream
        • org.openimaj.audio.processor.AudioProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<SampleChunk>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AudioConverter, AudioOverviewVisualisation.AudioOverviewGenerator, BeatDetector, BitDepthConverter, EQFilter, FFTBandPassFilter, FixedSizeSampleAudioProcessor, FourierTransform, FrequencyAudioSource, JAudioFeatureExtractor, MultichannelToMonoProcessor, MusicalNoteFilterBank, MusicalNoteOnsetDetector, PeakNormalisationCalculator, PowerCepstrumTransform, Preemphasiser, SampleRateConverter, VolumeAdjustProcessor

    public abstract class AudioProcessor
extends AudioStream
    An interface for objects that are able to process audio sample data. Due to the fact that audio processors provide processed audio, they are also able to implement the AudioStream interface thereby making processors chainable.
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    Created:
    8 Jun 2011

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioProcessor

        public AudioProcessor()
        A default constructor for processing sample chunks or files in an ad-hoc manner.

      • AudioProcessor

        public AudioProcessor(AudioStream a)
        Construct a new processor based on the given stream. This processor can then be used as a stream itself in a chain.
        Parameters:
        a - The audio stream to process.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        public void process(AudioStream a)
             throws Exception
        Function to process a whole audio stream. If the process returns null, it will stop the processing of the audio stream. Note that the output of the audio stream processing is not stored (it may be a live stream and so would be too large to store), so the caller must interact with the audio processor themselves to retrieve any useful information from the processing.
        Parameters:
        a - The audio stream to process.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the processing failed

      • process

        public abstract SampleChunk process(SampleChunk sample)
                             throws Exception
        Function that takes a sample chunk and processes the chunk. It should also return a sample chunk containing the processed data. If wished, the chunk may be side-affected and the input chunk returned. It should not be assumed that the input chunk will be side-affected, but it must be noted that it is possible that it could be. This process function may also return null. If null is returned it means that the rest of the audio stream is not required to be processed by this processing function. Whether the rest of the sample chunks are copied or ignored is up to the caller.
        Parameters:
        sample - The sample chunk to process.
        Returns:
        A sample chunk containing processed data.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the processing could not take place

      • processingComplete

        public void processingComplete(AudioStream a)
        Called when the processing of a given audio stream has been completed. This can be used to alter the audio stream's properties.
        Parameters:
        a - The audio stream that has finished processing.

      • nextSampleChunk

        public SampleChunk nextSampleChunk()
        Retrieve the next SampleChunk from the audio stream.
        Specified by:
        nextSampleChunk in class AudioStream
        Returns:
        The next sample chunk in the audio stream.
        See Also:

      • getUnderlyingStream

        public AudioStream getUnderlyingStream()
        Get the underlying stream. Will return null for non-chained audio processors.
        Returns:
        The underlying stream on chained processors.

      • setUnderlyingStream

        public void setUnderlyingStream(AudioStream stream)
        Sets the underlying stream, allowing it to be changed.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the audio stream. The implementation in this class just calls reset on the wrapped stream (if it's set).
        Specified by:
        reset in class AudioStream
        See Also:
        AudioStream.reset()

      • getLength

        public long getLength()
        Returns the length of the audio stream in milliseconds. If the length is unknown (for a live stream for example), then this method should return -1.
        Specified by:
        getLength in class AudioStream
        Returns:
        The length in milliseconds, or -1
        See Also:
        AudioStream.getLength()
